flawed_nl_solution:
The third dig site was dated from the year 8400 / 2 = <<8400/2=4020>>4020 BC.
Thus, the first dig site was dated from the year 4020 - 3700 = <<4020-3700=320>>320 BC.
The second dig site was 352 years older, so it was dated from the year 320 + 352 = <<320+352=672>>672 BC.
#### 672

error_details.explanation: The result of this computation should be 4200, not 4020. It appears two adjacent digits were swapped.
